Comments_List: A lot but its hard to discern specifically because it covered such a broad group of subjects
a little more insight into the textual traces of sensory cultures in SE Asia
Too many readings, not a deep enough dive, conversation could be more rigorous

The course was noble in its scope and what it was trying to do, but it fell short in practice. It needed to live up to its promise of engaging the world phenomenologically to really give me new tools for conducting academic work, which is what I was looking for when I signed up for the class. It took on too much and its analysis became superficial.
Yes, the topic was interesting, Finnenan was great and his lectures were excellent
Yes, if they needed an interesting yet easy class with a nice instructor.
